questions.question: Which of the following are object-oriented programming languages?
questions.hint: Think about languages that support classes and objects
explanations: Java, Python, and C# are object-oriented programming languages. C is procedural and Assembly is low-level.

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.hint: It's about marking up text for web pages
explanations: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, used for creating web pages.

questions.question: Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In, First Out)?
questions.hint: Think about a pile of plates
explanations: A Stack uses LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle, like a pile of plates.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search?
questions.hint: It divides the search space in half each time
explanations: Binary search has O(log n) time complexity because it divides the search space by half in each iteration.

questions.question: Which of these are valid JavaScript variable declarations?
questions.hint: JavaScript has multiple ways to declare variables
explanations: var, let, and const are valid JavaScript variable declarations. int and string are not JavaScript keywords.
